canonical_explanation.text: Plants are living things that grow all around us. There are different types of plants: trees are big and tall with thick trunks, shrubs are smaller with many branches, herbs are small soft plants, and climbers grow by climbing on walls or sticks. Every plant has parts: roots hold the plant in the soil and drink water, the stem carries water to all parts, leaves make food using sunlight, flowers are colourful and make seeds, fruits have seeds inside, and seeds grow into new plants. Plants need water, sunlight, air, and soil to grow. Plants are very useful to us. They give us food like fruits, vegetables, and grains. They give us shade, wood, medicine, and clean air to breathe.
rules: Trees are big and tall with thick, hard trunks.
Shrubs are shorter than trees and have many branches from near the ground.
Climbers need support to grow upward.
Every plant has roots, stem, leaves, and many have flowers, fruits, and seeds.
Plants need water, sunlight, air, and soil to grow.
Plants give us food, shade, wood, medicine, and clean air.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a big, tall plant with a thick trunk?
questions.explanation_correct: A tree is a big, tall plant with a thick, hard trunk. Examples are neem tree, mango tree, and banyan tree.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Herbs are small and soft. Climbers need support to grow. Grass is very short. Only trees are big and tall with thick trunks.

questions.question_text: Which part of a plant is under the ground?
questions.explanation_correct: Roots are under the ground. They hold the plant in the soil and take in water from the soil.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Leaves, flowers, and fruits are above the ground. Roots are the parts that grow under the ground.

questions.question_text: What do plants need to grow?
questions.explanation_correct: Plants need water and sunlight to grow. They also need air and soil. These help the plant make food and stay healthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Plants do not need toys, pencils, or shoes. They need water, sunlight, air, and soil to grow and survive.

questions.question_text: We get fruits from:
questions.explanation_correct: We get fruits from plants. Mango, apple, banana, and guava are all fruits that grow on plants and trees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We cannot get fruits from stones, books, or chairs. Fruits grow on plants and trees.

questions.question_text: Which part of a plant makes food using sunlight?
questions.explanation_correct: Leaves make food for the plant using sunlight. That is why leaves are green and face towards the sun.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Roots take in water. The stem carries water. Fruits have seeds. Leaves are the parts that make food for the plant.

questions.question_text: A plant that needs a wall or stick to grow up is called a:
questions.explanation_correct: A climber is a plant that needs support like a wall, stick, or rope to grow upward. Money plant and grapevine are climbers.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Trees are tall and strong. Herbs are small and soft. Shrubs have many branches. Climbers are the ones that need a wall or stick to grow up.

questions.question_text: Which part of a plant carries water from roots to leaves?
questions.explanation_correct: The stem carries water from the roots up to the leaves and other parts of the plant. It is like a pipe for the plant.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Flowers, fruits, and seeds do not carry water. The stem is the part that moves water from the roots to the rest of the plant.

questions.question_text: A new plant grows from a:
questions.explanation_correct: A new plant grows from a seed. When we plant a seed in soil and give it water and sunlight, it grows into a new plant.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Plants do not grow from stones, pencils, or glasses. Seeds are the tiny parts that grow into new plants.

questions.question_text: A shrub is:

options.text: Very tall like a neem tree
Shorter than a tree with many branches near the ground
A tiny soft plant like mint
A plant that grows on walls

questions.explanation_correct: A shrub is shorter than a tree and has many branches that start near the ground. Rose plant and hibiscus are shrubs.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Very tall plants are trees, not shrubs. Tiny soft plants are herbs. Plants that grow on walls are climbers. Shrubs are medium-sized with many branches.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a herb?
questions.explanation_correct: Tulsi is a herb. It is a small, soft plant. Herbs are small plants with soft and green stems.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Neem tree is a tree. Money plant is a climber. Rose bush is a shrub. Tulsi is a small herb that grows in many Indian homes.

questions.question_text: The colourful part of a plant that makes seeds is the:
questions.explanation_correct: Flowers are the colourful parts of a plant. They help make seeds, which can grow into new plants.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Roots are under the ground. Stems carry water. Leaves make food. Flowers are the colourful parts that help make seeds.

questions.question_text: Where are seeds usually found?
questions.explanation_correct: Seeds are usually found inside the fruits. When you eat a mango or watermelon, you can see the seeds inside.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Seeds are not inside roots, stems, or on top of leaves. They grow inside fruits like mango, apple, and watermelon.

questions.question_text: Plants give us clean ___ to breathe.
questions.explanation_correct: Plants give us clean air to breathe. They take in dirty air and give out fresh air that we need to live.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Plants do give us food, but the question is about breathing. We breathe air, not water, food, or clothes. Plants give us clean air.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a tree?
questions.explanation_correct: Peepal is a big, tall tree with a thick trunk. It is found in many places in India.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Tulsi and mint are herbs. Money plant is a climber. Peepal is the only tree in this list.

questions.question_text: What holds a plant firmly in the soil?
questions.explanation_correct: Roots hold the plant firmly in the soil. They go deep into the ground and keep the plant standing strong.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Leaves, flowers, and fruits are above the ground. Roots are under the ground and hold the plant in its place.

questions.question_text: We get wood from:
questions.explanation_correct: We get wood from trees. Trees have thick, hard trunks and branches that give us wood for making furniture, houses, and paper.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Herbs, climbers, and grass are too small and soft to give us wood. Only trees have hard, thick trunks that give us wood.

questions.question_text: Which of these do plants NOT need to grow?
questions.explanation_correct: Plants do not need toys to grow! They need water, sunlight, air, and soil. Toys are for children to play with, not for plants.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Plants need water, sunlight, and air to grow. They do not need toys. Toys have nothing to do with how plants grow.

questions.question_text: On a hot sunny day, we sit under a tree for:
questions.explanation_correct: We sit under a tree for shade. The big leaves and branches of a tree block the hot sun and give us a cool place to rest.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do get wood, paper, and medicine from trees, but when we sit under a tree on a hot day, we are looking for shade to cool down.

questions.question_text: Which is the correct order of plant growth?
questions.explanation_correct: First a seed is planted, then it grows into a plant, and then the plant makes flowers. This is the correct order.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Plants start from seeds. The seed grows into a plant, and then the plant makes flowers, which make fruits and more seeds.

questions.question_text: Anita put a seed in a dark cupboard without water. Will it grow?

options.text: Yes, seeds do not need anything
No, it needs water and sunlight to grow
No, because cupboards are too big

questions.explanation_correct: The seed will not grow because it needs water and sunlight. Without these, the seed cannot start growing into a plant.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Seeds need water, sunlight, air, and soil to grow. Just being warm is not enough. A dark cupboard without water will not help a seed grow.

questions.question_text: Raju saw a plant growing on a wall. What type of plant is it?
questions.explanation_correct: A plant that grows on a wall is a climber. Climbers use walls, sticks, and other things as support to grow upward.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Trees are big and grow on their own. Herbs are small. Shrubs have many branches. A plant on a wall is a climber because it uses the wall for support.

questions.question_text: Why are roots important for a plant?

options.text: They make the plant look pretty
They hold the plant in the soil and take in water
They give us fruits to eat

questions.explanation_correct: Roots are very important. They hold the plant in the soil so it does not fall, and they drink water from the soil for the plant.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Roots do not make flowers or fruits directly. Their main jobs are to hold the plant firmly in the soil and take in water.

questions.question_text: Meena watered her plant every day but kept it in a dark room. What will happen?

options.text: The plant will grow very well
The plant will not grow well because it needs sunlight
The plant will turn into a tree
The plant will not need sunlight

questions.explanation_correct: The plant will not grow well because it needs sunlight to make food. Water alone is not enough. Plants need both water and sunlight.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Even with water, a plant needs sunlight to stay healthy. Without sunlight, the plant cannot make food and will become weak.

questions.question_text: Which of these fruits has a big seed inside?
questions.explanation_correct: A mango has one big seed inside it. When you eat a mango, you can see the big flat seed in the middle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Bananas have tiny seeds. Grapes have small seeds. Watermelons have many small seeds. Mangoes have one large seed inside.

questions.question_text: Neem leaves are used as medicine. This shows that plants give us:
questions.explanation_correct: Neem leaves are used as medicine. This shows that plants give us medicine to help us get better when we are sick.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Plants do not give us toys or books. Neem leaves are used as medicine, showing that plants help us stay healthy.

questions.question_text: A banyan tree has a very thick trunk. It is a:
questions.explanation_correct: A banyan tree is a big, tall plant with a very thick trunk and long branches. It is one of the biggest trees in India.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Herbs are small and soft. Climbers need walls. Shrubs are medium-sized. A banyan with a thick trunk is a tree.

questions.question_text: Why do plants need soil?

options.text: Roots hold on to soil and get water and nutrients from it

questions.explanation_correct: Plants need soil because their roots grow in it. Roots hold on to the soil to keep the plant standing and take in water and food from the soil.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Soil is not for playing or making plants dirty. It gives plants a place to stand and provides water and food through the roots.

questions.question_text: We eat rice, wheat, and dal. Where do these come from?
questions.explanation_correct: Rice, wheat, and dal all come from plants. Rice grows on a paddy plant, wheat grows on wheat plants, and dal comes from lentil plants.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rice, wheat, and dal are not from animals, rocks, or water. They are all foods that come from different types of plants.

questions.question_text: Sunita planted a seed. She gave it water and placed it in sunlight. After a few days, a tiny green ___ came out.
questions.explanation_correct: When a seed gets water and sunlight, a tiny green shoot comes out. This shoot grows into a plant over time.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A stone, toy, or book cannot come from a seed. When a seed grows, a small green shoot comes out first. This shoot becomes a plant.

questions.question_text: Which plant part do we eat when we eat a carrot?
questions.explanation_correct: A carrot is a root. When we eat a carrot, we are eating the root of the carrot plant that grows under the ground.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A carrot is not a leaf, stem, or flower. It is a root that grows under the ground. We dig it out and eat it.

questions.question_text: When we eat spinach (palak), which part of the plant are we eating?
questions.explanation_correct: When we eat spinach or palak, we are eating the leaves of the plant. Leaves are green and are used by plants to make food.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Spinach is not a root, flower, or fruit. It is the leaves of the spinach plant that we cook and eat.

questions.question_text: Money plant grows by climbing on walls and windows. It is a:
questions.explanation_correct: Money plant is a climber. It uses walls, windows, and sticks to grow upward because its stem is not strong enough to stand alone.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Money plant is not a tree, herb, or shrub. It climbs on things to grow, so it is a climber.

questions.question_text: Why should we not cut trees?

options.text: Trees give us fruits, shade, wood, and clean air

questions.explanation_correct: We should not cut trees because they give us many things like fruits, shade, wood, and clean air. Without trees, animals lose their homes too.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Trees are living and very useful. They give us food, shade, clean air, and wood. Cutting trees harms us and the animals that live in them.

questions.question_text: Rani planted a seed in soil, gave it water, and put it in sunlight. After two weeks the plant had roots, a stem, and leaves. Which part appeared first?
questions.explanation_correct: The root appears first when a seed grows. The root goes down into the soil to get water, and then the shoot comes up with the stem and leaves.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Flowers and fruits come much later. First the root grows, then the stem and leaves come up. The root is always the first part to appear.

questions.question_text: Which of these gives us BOTH food and shade?
questions.explanation_correct: A mango tree gives us both food (mangoes) and shade because it is a big, tall tree with a wide spread of branches and leaves.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Tulsi is too small for shade. Money plant climbs on walls. Grass is too short. Only the mango tree is big enough to give both food and shade.

questions.question_text: A rose plant has many branches starting from near the ground. It is a:
questions.explanation_correct: A rose plant is a shrub because it has many branches that start from near the ground. Shrubs are shorter than trees but bigger than herbs.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Trees are tall with one thick trunk. Herbs are small and soft. Climbers grow on walls. A rose plant with many branches near the ground is a shrub.

questions.question_text: Match: We eat the ROOT of which plant?
questions.explanation_correct: We eat the root of a radish (mooli) plant. Radish grows under the ground, just like carrot and beetroot.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Spinach is a leaf we eat. Cauliflower is a flower we eat. Potato is a stem that grows underground. Radish is a root.

questions.question_text: If there were no plants on Earth, what would happen?

options.text: We would have no food, no clean air, and no shade

questions.explanation_correct: Without plants, we would have no food like fruits and vegetables, no clean air to breathe, and no shade. Plants are very important for life on Earth.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Plants are very important. Without them, there would be no food for animals or people, the air would be dirty, and there would be no shade.

questions.question_text: Arun planted two seeds. He gave water to one and no water to the other. Which one will grow?
questions.explanation_correct: The seed that got water will grow. Seeds need water to start growing. Without water, a seed cannot sprout.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Seeds need water to grow. The seed without water will stay dry and will not sprout. Only the watered seed will grow into a plant.

questions.question_text: Plants are living things.
questions.explanation_correct: Plants are living things because they need water, air, and sunlight. They grow, make food, and can make new plants from seeds.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Plants are living things. They grow, need water and sunlight, and can make new plants. They are not non-living.

questions.question_text: Roots are above the ground.
questions.explanation_correct: Roots are not above the ground. They grow under the ground in the soil. They hold the plant in place and take in water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Roots grow under the ground, not above it. The stem, leaves, and flowers are above the ground.

questions.question_text: Trees have thick, hard trunks.
questions.explanation_correct: Trees like neem, banyan, and mango have thick, hard trunks that hold them up tall and strong.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Trees have thick, hard trunks that help them stand tall. Herbs have thin, soft stems.

questions.question_text: Leaves make food for the plant.
questions.explanation_correct: Leaves make food for the plant using sunlight, water, and air. That is why leaves are so important for a plant.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Leaves are like the kitchen of a plant. They use sunlight to make food for the whole plant.

questions.question_text: A plant can grow without water.
questions.explanation_correct: A plant cannot grow without water. Water is one of the most important things a plant needs. Without water, it will dry up and die.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Plants need water to survive and grow. Without water, the plant will become weak, dry up, and die.

questions.question_text: A climber can stand tall on its own without any support.
questions.explanation_correct: A climber cannot stand on its own. It needs a wall, stick, or rope to climb on. Its stem is too weak to stand alone.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Climbers have weak stems and need support like walls or sticks. Trees can stand on their own, but climbers cannot.

questions.question_text: We get vegetables from plants.
questions.explanation_correct: We get vegetables like potato, tomato, spinach, and brinjal from plants. Plants give us many types of food.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Vegetables come from plants. We eat different parts of plants as vegetables.

questions.question_text: Seeds can grow into new plants.
questions.explanation_correct: Seeds can grow into new plants when they get water, soil, and sunlight. Each seed has a baby plant inside it waiting to grow.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Seeds grow into new plants. That is how new trees, flowers, and crops are born.

questions.question_text: Herbs are bigger than trees.
questions.explanation_correct: Herbs are NOT bigger than trees. Herbs are small, soft plants. Trees are very big and tall. Trees are the biggest type of plant.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Herbs like tulsi and mint are much smaller than trees like neem and banyan. Trees are the tallest and biggest plants.

questions.question_text: The stem of a plant carries water from roots to leaves.
questions.explanation_correct: The stem carries water from the roots up to the leaves and other parts. It works like a pipe inside the plant.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. The stem is like a highway for water. It takes water from the roots and sends it to the leaves.

questions.question_text: Plants give us clean air to breathe.
questions.explanation_correct: Plants take in dirty air and give out clean, fresh air. This is why we should plant more trees and take care of plants.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Plants are very important because they clean the air and give us fresh air to breathe.
